name: tileset_floor_empty_32.png
description: A seamless 2D game tile of an empty floor, rendered in cute chibi pixel art style. The tile is viewed from an orthogonal top-down view with zero vanishing points and no perspective depth, completely flat 2D tilemap. The floor is a soft warm beige-tan base (#D9C7A3) with a subtle repeating pixel pattern suggesting clean stone or ceramic tiles: small 2–3 pixel speckles in slightly darker tan (#C3B08F) and lighter cream (#E8D9BE) scattered evenly. Add faint square tile seams: 1-pixel-wide lines forming a 2×2 sub-grid inside the 32×32 tile, seams in slightly darker tan (#B79F78), kept low-contrast so it doesn’t overpower gameplay. Corners and all four edges must match perfectly for seamless tiling; pattern density remains consistent at edges. Features bold black outlines only where needed for tiny cracks/speckles (no heavy outlines around the tile perimeter). Flat colors, no gradients, no shadows, no lighting effects; clean edges suitable for sprite extraction. The image is fully filled by the floor texture (no extra background).

name: tileset_wall_indestructible_32.png
description: A seamless 2D game tile of an indestructible wall block, rendered in cute chibi pixel art style. Orthogonal top-down view, zero perspective depth, completely flat 2D tilemap. The tile depicts a chunky stone/brick block that visually reads as solid and permanent: a cool gray-blue palette with the main block face in medium gray-blue (#7E8FA6), darker mortar/crevice lines (#4E5C70), and small highlight pixels in pale blue-gray (#AAB8C8). The wall fills the entire 32×32 tile, with an internal brick pattern: 2 rows of large bricks (each brick about 12–14 pixels wide, 8–10 pixels tall), offset like a running bond; mortar lines are 1–2 pixels thick. Add 3–5 small chips/cracks as 1-pixel notches along brick edges for texture. All four edges must tile seamlessly so that adjacent wall tiles connect with continuous brick/mortar pattern; no visible seams. Features bold black outlines on key brick boundaries (1 pixel), flat colors, no gradients, no shadows, no lighting effects. The image is fully filled by the wall texture (no extra background).

name: tileset_wall_destructible_32.png
description: A seamless 2D game tile of a destructible wall/crate, rendered in cute chibi pixel art style. Orthogonal top-down view, no perspective depth, completely flat 2D tilemap. The tile reads as breakable: a warm orange-brown wooden crate/soft brick look with clear structure. Use a base wood color (#C88A4A) with darker plank lines (#8A5A2B) and light highlight pixels (#E7B57A). The destructible block fills the 32×32 tile. Depict an internal pattern of 3 vertical planks (each about 9–10 pixels wide) separated by 1–2 pixel dark lines, plus a diagonal cross-brace “X” made of 2-pixel-wide darker strips crossing from corners to center. Add a few small nicks: 1–2 pixel chips on edges. All four edges must tile seamlessly if many destructible tiles are adjacent; avoid unique corner markings that would break repetition, keep the plank seams and cross-brace aligned so repeats look intentional. Bold black outlines on the outer edges of the crate silhouette and on the cross-brace edges (1 pixel). Flat colors, no gradients, no shadows, no lighting effects. The image is fully filled by the destructible texture (no extra background).

name: player_idle_down_32.png
description: A high-quality 2D game character sprite of the Bomberman-like player, rendered in cute chibi pixel art style. The character is viewed in a direct front view (used for facing down in top-down games), with zero perspective depth, completely flat 2D sprite. The character stands centered and occupies ~80% of the 32×32 frame height. Design: a round white helmet/head with a clear bold black outline (1–2 pixels), a small face opening/visor area in pale peach (#F2C7A5) with two simple black dot eyes spaced 4–5 pixels apart; no mouth. Add a small pink antenna ball on top center (ball ~4×4 pixels) with a short black-outlined stem. Body: a compact suit in bright blue (#2E6BE6) with darker blue accents (#1F3F9A) at the waist and glove cuffs; mitt-like gloves in white with black outline; boots in pink-red (#E24A6A) with darker shading (#A82E47) but still flat (no gradients). Arms hang slightly outward from torso, hands near hips; legs together with slight separation line (1 pixel) between boots. Features bold black outlines, solid flat colors, no shadows, no lighting effects, no depth of field. Isolated on a solid white background (#FFFFFF).

name: player_idle_up_32.png
description:
This is a partial image edit. Keep everything identical: cute chibi pixel art style, same character proportions, helmet shape, antenna ball, suit colors, gloves/boots design, bold black outlines, flat colors, identical 32×32 bounding box and centering, solid white background (#FFFFFF), no shadows or lighting.

The only change: the character is viewed from a direct back view (used for facing up), so the face/eyes are not visible. The helmet shows a simple back panel detail: a centered vertical seam line (1 pixel, dark gray) and a small rectangular hatch-like detail (about 6×4 pixels) on the upper-back of the helmet. The torso shows a small backpack-like bump (about 10×8 pixels) centered on the upper back in blue with black outline.

Do NOT change anything else in the image.

name: player_idle_left_32.png
description:
This is a partial image edit. Keep everything identical: cute chibi pixel art style, same palette, helmet/antenna design, suit/gloves/boots, bold black outlines, flat colors, identical 32×32 bounding box and centering, solid white background (#FFFFFF), no shadows or lighting.

The only change: the character is viewed strictly from a side profile facing left. Only the left side of the helmet and body is visible; the far-side arm/leg are fully hidden. The face opening becomes a side visor: a small pale peach area on the front-left of the head with a single black dot eye placed near the center of that visor. The antenna ball remains centered on top but its stem aligns with the head centerline.

Do NOT change anything else in the image.

name: bomb_idle_32.png
description: A high-quality 2D game object sprite of a classic round bomb, rendered in cute chibi pixel art style. Orthogonal top-down view, completely flat 2D sprite with zero perspective depth. The bomb is centered and occupies ~70% of the 32×32 frame. Shape: a near-perfect black sphere with bold black outline still visible via a slightly lighter rim (dark charcoal #2A2A2A) and inner fill (#0B0B0B). At the top center is a short fuse (about 6 pixels tall) in tan (#C9A16A) with a black outline, ending in a small red-orange cap. Add a tiny highlight cluster (2–3 pixels) on the upper-left of the sphere in dark gray (#3A3A3A) but keep it flat (no gradients). No shadows, no lighting effects. Clean edges for sprite extraction. Isolated on a solid white background (#FFFFFF).

name: bomb_fuse_1_32.png
description:
This is a partial image edit. Keep everything identical: orthogonal top-down bomb, same sphere size/position, same palette, fuse shape and placement, bold outlines, flat colors, 32×32 bounding box, solid white background (#FFFFFF).

The only change: the fuse tip shows a small spark cluster: 4–6 pixels around the fuse end in bright yellow (#FFD23C) and orange (#FF8A2A) with a 1-pixel black outline around the cluster silhouette. The spark extends 2–3 pixels to the upper-right of the fuse tip.

Do NOT change anything else in the image.

name: explosion_center_32.png
description: A high-quality 2D game effect sprite of an explosion center tile, rendered in cute chibi pixel art style. Orthogonal top-down view, completely flat 2D sprite, zero perspective depth. The explosion fills most of the 32×32 frame (~90%), centered. Shape: a rounded starburst with 8 soft spikes (cardinal spikes longer), outlined with bold black line (1–2 pixels). Color scheme: bright yellow core (#FFE45C) with orange mid band (#FF9B3D) and a red outer band (#E24A3A), all as solid flat regions (no gradients). Add 3–4 small detached embers (2×2 pixels) near corners in orange with black outline. No shadows, no lighting effects. Isolated on a solid white background (#FFFFFF).

name: explosion_horizontal_32.png
description: A high-quality 2D game effect sprite of an explosion arm (horizontal segment), rendered in cute chibi pixel art style. Orthogonal top-down view, completely flat 2D sprite. The explosion segment is a horizontal flame bar centered vertically, spanning ~90% of the tile width, with rounded ends. Bold black outline (1–2 pixels) around the flame silhouette. Flat colors: yellow core (#FFE45C) in a long oval band, orange mid band (#FF9B3D), red outer band (#E24A3A). The center is slightly thicker (about 12 pixels tall) tapering to ~8 pixels at ends. No gradients, no shadows, no lighting effects. Isolated on solid white background (#FFFFFF).

The only change: the explosion segment is vertical instead of horizontal, spanning ~90% of the tile height, centered horizontally, with rounded ends. The yellow core and orange/red bands rotate accordingly.

Do NOT change anything else in the image.

The tip ends about 3 pixels below the top edge. No gradients, no shadows, no lighting effects. Isolated on solid white background (#FFFFFF).

name: enemy_slime_idle_down_32.png

Shape: a rounded jelly blob with a slightly scalloped bottom edge (3 small bumps). Palette: mint green body (#55D6A6) with darker green outline/shadow rim (#2E8C6B) but still flat. Bold black outline around the silhouette (1–2 pixels). Face: two black oval eyes spaced 6 pixels apart, and a tiny flat mouth line (2 pixels wide) in dark green. Add two small highlight spots (2×2 pixels) in pale mint (#8AF0CB) on upper-left. No gradients, no shadows, no lighting effects. Isolated on solid white background (#FFFFFF).

name: powerup_extra_bomb_32.png
description: A high-quality 2D game power-up icon sprite for Extra Bomb, rendered in cute chibi pixel art style. Orthogonal top-down view, completely flat 2D sprite. Centered and occupying ~75% of the 32×32 frame. Depict a small red gift-like tile icon: a rounded square badge in bright red (#E24A3A) with bold black outline, with a black bomb symbol in the center (tiny circular bomb with fuse). Add a bright yellow plus sign “+” in the top-right corner of the badge (plus is about 7×7 pixels, outlined in black). Flat colors, no gradients, no shadows or lighting effects. Isolated on a solid white background (#FFFFFF).

name: powerup_range_32.png
description: A high-quality 2D game power-up icon sprite for Increased Range, rendered in cute chibi pixel art style. Orthogonal top-down view, completely flat 2D sprite. Centered and occupying ~75% of the 32×32 frame. Depict a rounded square badge in orange (#FF9B3D) with bold black outline. In the center, show a stylized explosion cross icon: a small yellow starburst center with short arms extending up/down/left/right by 3–4 pixels, outlined in black. Add a bright yellow plus sign “+” in the top-right corner (7×7 pixels) outlined in black. Flat colors, no gradients, no shadows or lighting. Isolated on solid white background (#FFFFFF).

name: powerup_speed_32.png
description: A high-quality 2D game power-up icon sprite for Speed Boost, rendered in cute chibi pixel art style. Orthogonal top-down view, completely flat 2D sprite. Centered and occupying ~75% of the 32×32 frame. Depict a rounded square badge in sky blue (#4DB7FF) with bold black outline. In the center, show a white wing icon or speed lines: three horizontal white streaks (each 8–10 pixels long) stacked with 2 pixels vertical spacing, each outlined in black on the top edge to keep readability. Add a bright yellow plus sign “+” in the top-right corner (7×7 pixels) outlined in black. Flat colors, no gradients, no shadows or lighting. Isolated on solid white background (#FFFFFF).

name: ui_title_bomberman_256x96.png
description: A high-quality 2D UI title asset showing the text "BOMBERMAN" in cute chibi pixel art style. Direct front view, completely flat 2D graphic with zero perspective depth. The word is centered and occupies ~85% of the width and ~70% of the height. Lettering: thick, rounded block pixel letters with bold black outlines (2–3 pixels). Fill each letter with a cheerful gradient-free flat scheme: alternating cyan (#4DB7FF) and pink (#E24A6A) letters, with a small 1–2 pixel white inner highlight stripe near the top-left of each letter (still flat). Add a simple bomb icon replacing the letter "O": a small black round bomb with a tiny yellow spark. No shadows, no glow, no lighting effects. Isolated on a solid white background (#FFFFFF).

name: ui_button_start_160x48.png
description: A high-quality 2D UI button asset labeled "START GAME", rendered in cute chibi pixel art style. Direct front view, completely flat 2D graphic. A rounded rectangle button centered in the frame, occupying ~85% width and ~70% height. Button base fill: bright green (#55D6A6) with a darker green inner border (#2E8C6B) inset by 2 pixels, and a bold black outer outline (2 pixels). Text: "START GAME" in white (#FFFFFF) with a 2-pixel black outline, blocky pixel font, horizontally centered and vertically centered. No shadows, no lighting effects, no depth of field. Background is solid pure white (#FFFFFF).

No shadows, no lighting effects. Solid white background (#FFFFFF).

Panel fill: very light gray-blue (#E6EEF7) with a darker blue border (#7E8FA6) inset by 2 pixels and a bold black outer outline (2 pixels). Leave the center area empty (no text), sized to fit 6 digits at 24px-tall pixel font. No shadows, no lighting effects. Solid white background (#FFFFFF).

name: tilemap_level1_example_512x512.png
description: A complete level background tilemap mockup for Level 1, rendered in cute chibi pixel art style. Orthogonal top-down view, zero perspective depth, completely flat 2D tilemap. The map is a 16×16 grid of 32×32 tiles (total 512×512). Use only the three tile visuals defined by the tileset assets: empty floor (warm beige), indestructible wall (cool gray-blue bricks), destructible wall (warm orange-brown crate/wood). Composition requirements: (1) Outer border is a continuous ring of indestructible wall tiles on all edges. (2) Interior indestructible walls form a readable maze pattern with evenly spaced pillars: place indestructible wall blocks at every other tile in a checker-like pillar arrangement (classic Bomberman feel), ensuring lanes and corners. (3) Destructible walls populate many corridor spaces but leave a safe spawn pocket: top-left corner spawn area is open floor for a 3×3 region (tiles (1..3,1..3) in grid coordinates excluding border), and additionally keep the adjacent right and down corridor tiles clear for immediate movement. (4) Ensure at least 3 distinct open lanes connecting across the map, with choke points and corners; destructible walls should create breakable pathways but not fully seal off large regions. Color scheme must remain consistent: floors warm and clean, indestructible walls cool and sturdy, destructible walls warm and breakable. Technical: crisp pixel edges, no gradients, no shadows or lighting effects. The entire canvas is filled by the tilemap; no extra background.
